Description: Necklace: a gold sphinx amulet and an electrum ibis amulet. The ibis, of flat sheet electrum, is without detail and has a back suspension loop. The sphinx, which has roughly incised details on the face and haunches, is basically a gold cylinder bead with front paws and head. The tail curves up above the back to meet the top of the head.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, Grave 637 Registered as having been at the neck
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: two beads (1929,1015.495). Found together with three small beads of glazed composition, which can no longer be traced. Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), pl.LV, 2; Tomb register, pl.XLVII; Bead corpus, pl.LVI, 29A6; pl.LVII, 47C12; C. Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (London, 1994), fig.62.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (331)
